Difficult to Understand

When your child speaks, do you find yourself asking "What did you say?" or struggling to understand their words? Speech clarity issues are common and very treatable with the right support.

Common Speech Clarity Concerns

  • Difficulty pronouncing certain sounds (like 'r', 's', or 'th')
  • Substituting one sound for another
  • Leaving sounds out of words
  • Speech that sounds unclear or "muddy"
  • Frustration from not being understood

Our Articulation Therapy Approach

We use evidence-based techniques to help your child speak more clearly:

  • Fun, engaging activities that target specific sounds
  • Visual and tactile cues to help with sound placement
  • Practice exercises that progress from simple to complex
  • Home activities to reinforce learning
  • Confidence-building strategies

What to Expect

Most children see significant improvement in their speech clarity with consistent therapy. We'll work together to create a plan that fits your child's specific needs and learning style.
